intro: Vermifuga, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features yellow flowers with a distinctive, sticky center that attracts pollinators like bees and flies. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a somewhat bitter taste. Vermifuga is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
